note: Poverty data is measured in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices to account for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: Child mortality vs. share in extreme poverty
subtitle: Child mortality is the number of children who die before reaching their fifth birthday per 1,000 live births, versus the share of the population living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day.
sourceDesc: UN IGME (2023), World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2022)
